meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your favorite seasonal grok video game reviewer here, and I'm excited to dive into LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2!

Let me start by saying that this game is a masterclass in not rocking the boat. It sticks to the tried-and-true formula of its predecessors while still managing to surprise and delight. I mean, who wouldn't want to play as Spider-Man, Doctor Strange, or Captain America (because, let's be real, he's the best Avenger)?

But seriously, IGN got it right when they said that this game is "constantly fun to play" – especially in co-op mode! There's something special about teaming up with friends and taking down bad guys together. It's like being part of a superhero squad (minus the whole 'saving the world' thing).

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But wait, don't all LEGO games feel the same?" Well, yes...and no. See, while the gameplay may not be revolutionary, the sheer variety of characters, locations, and situations is what makes this game shine. It's like having a Marvel-themed playground at your fingertips!

Of course, not everyone will agree. GameSpot took issue with the game's formulaic approach, saying it's starting to "sag somewhat." And hey, I get it – after all these years, the LEGO formula can start to feel stale if you're playing them back-to-back (which, let's be real, some people might do). But for me, the charm of this game lies in its nostalgic value. It's like revisiting an old friend who never fails to put a smile on your face.

Now, I'm not gonna lie – there are some criticisms out there. Vandal said it didn't have many new features, but honestly, I think that's part of the charm. Why mess with what ain't broke, right? And Destructoid took issue with the game's lack of innovation, saying its core mechanics feel "rooted firmly in the past." But hey, if you ask me, that's just part of the LEGO magic – it's a tried-and-true formula that works like a charm.

In conclusion, LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a fantastic addition to the series. It may not break new ground, but it's still a delightful romp through the Marvel universe. So grab some popcorn, gather your friends, and get ready for an action-packed adventure that will leave you feeling like a true superhero!

(Hippo Penny out!)
